title: Longest Common Prefix
description: Write a function to find the longest common prefix string amongst an array of strings. If there is no common prefix, return an empty string. A common prefix is defined as a substring that appears at the start of every string in the array.
output_format: A string representing the longest common prefix.
constraints: strs[i] consists of only lowercase English letters.

examples.explanation: There is no common prefix among the strings.

hints: Compare characters of each string in the array until they differ.
You can start with the first string as a prefix.

title: Palindrome Number
description: Given an integer x, return true if x is a palindrome, and false otherwise. A palindrome is a number that reads the same backward as forward.
output_format: A boolean indicating whether the number is a palindrome.

examples.explanation: 121 reads the same backward as forward.
-121 reads as 121- and is not a palindrome.
10 reads as 01 and is not a palindrome.

hints: Try converting the number to a string.
Consider edge cases for negative numbers.
